items.title: Like a screwdriver in my face - Life with 'the world's most painful known medical condition'
items.summary: Trigeminal neuralgia is a rare condition where something as simple as a gust of wind can cause excruciating pain.

items.title: Families of children with cancer to have travel costs covered
items.summary: The government sets aside £10 million a year to help families and young people under 24 access cancer treatment.

items.title: UK homes to get £15bn for solar and green tech to cut energy bills
items.summary: The government has announced the details of its long-awaited Warm Homes Plan which promises to cut energy bills.

items.title: Global temperatures dipped in 2025 but more heat records on way, scientists warn
items.summary: The last three years were Earth's hottest on record, as humanity's carbon emissions continue to heat the planet.

items.title: What is happening to flu this winter - and should you buy a vaccine?
items.summary: Flu has come early this year with a new mutated version of the virus circulating.

items.title: How Christmas trees are getting a new lease of life
items.summary: Some businesses are helping to recycle and reuse trees in a bid to reduce landfill and emissions.

items.title: Landmark deal to cut global shipping emissions in tatters after US pressure
items.summary: President Trump intervened in the talks calling the deal a "green scam".

items.title: Green turtle bounces back from brink in conservation 'win'
items.summary: Once endangered due to hunting, it is making a strong recovery thanks to global conservation efforts.

items.title: 'How growing a sunflower helped me fight anorexia'
items.summary: 'Green social prescribing' schemes are being used by NHS doctors to improve patients' mental health.
